Description: Fragment of Attic black-figured pottery vessel; almost flat, with no visible potting marks; reverse reserved. Athena to right, her left hand raised; in front of her, a warrior fighting to right; his raised right arm and perhaps the end of his helmet crest remain. Unclear remains to left, possibly another female figure. Added white for Athena's flesh and dots on her garment; added red and white on what is behind her.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 95 no. 332 pl. 71)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2179)
